def classify_random_forest(max_depth, n_estimators, min_samples_split, max_features, criterion):
    """
    This function takes the parameters of a random forest algorithm and returns a string 
    that describes the instance of the random forest algorithm.

    Parameters:
    max_depth (int): The maximum depth of each tree in the forest.
    n_estimators (int): The number of trees in the forest.
    min_samples_split (int): The minimum number of samples required to split an internal node.
    max_features (str or int): The number of features to consider when looking for the best split.
    criterion (str): The function used to measure the quality of a split.

    Returns:
    str: A string describing the instance of the random forest algorithm.
    """
    description = f'{max_depth}, consists of {n_estimators} trees, uses a minimum of {min_samples_split} samples to split nodes, considers {max_features} features for splitting, and uses {criterion} as the criterion for splitting.'
    return description

mutants.original_line: f"This instance of the random forest algorithm has a maximum depth of {max_depth}, "
mutants.mutated_line: description = f'This instance of the random forest algorithm has a maximum depth of {max_depth}{n_estimators} trees, uses a minimum of {min_samples_split} samples to split nodes, considers {max_features} features for splitting, and uses {criterion} as the criterion for splitting.'
